H0.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Louis Pasteur

H1.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek

H2.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Edward Jenner

H3.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Robert Koch

A4.text: His discovery of the anthrax bacterium (Bacillus anthracis) in 1876 is considered as the birth of modern bacteriology.

A5.text: He discovered the formation of spores in anthrax bacteria, which could remain dormant under specific conditions.
